H0.text: The dull brown color of female Indigo buntings helps male birds find a mate, aiding the species' survival during summer nesting in Florida.

H1.text: It helps the dull brown female indigo buntings find food more easily, which assists the species in surviving during their Florida summer nesting period.

H2.text: It helps hide the female Indigo buntings, which nest in Florida during the summer, while they sit on their nests, aiding the species' survival.

H3.text: It helps the birds find the flock when migrating, which is how the dull brown color of female Indigo buntings helps the species survive.

A4.text: The male is vibrant blue in the summer, with brightly colored plumage during the breeding season to attract a mate.

A5.text: Members of the cat family such as the snow leopard (treeless highlands), tiger (grassy plains, reed swamps), ocelot (forest), fishing cat (waterside thickets), and lion (open plains) are camouflaged with coloration and disruptive patterns suiting their habitats.
